title: Why Eddie Murphy Is Still a Legend
text: Eddie Murphy was 19 years old in 1980 when he exploded into the American consciousness on Saturday Night Live, bringing urban sass, pop-culture insight and wicked wit to characters like Gumby, Mister Robinson and Buckwheat, while in the process reviving the flagging comedy franchise. Two years later he co-starred in 48 Hrs., in which he walked into a white country-western bar, took the measure of its patrons and walked out a movie star. After his 1983 stand-up special, Delirious, Murphy became as ubiquitous as superstar peers Michael Jackson, Prince and Madonna, making blockbuster movies (Beverly Hills Cop, Coming to...
description: One of America’s most beloved performers, Eddie Murphy has been making audiences laugh since he was a teenager
